intro: Eritrichium lianyongshanii, commonly known as the Lianyongshan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet petals and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high altitudes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of showy flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
